general.name: mangaArc
general.short: This is the extracted arc frame.
general.description: This is the extracted arc frame, including wavelenght calibration and removal of fiber-to-fiber flat field variatios. The format is similar to BOSS spArc files, with the exception of a blank extension 0, and extension names vs numbers.

surveys.name: MaNGA
surveys.long: Mapping Nearby Galaxies at Apache Point Observatory
surveys.description: A wide-field optical spectroscopic IFU survey of extragalactic sources to study galaxy dynamics and kinematics

general.naming_convention: mgArc-[camera]-[exposure].fits.gz where [camera] is one of the four cameras on the instrument, b1, r1, or b2, r2, for the blue and red cameras on each SDSS spectrograph, and [exposure] is the (zero-padded) 8-digit exposure number.'

changelog.description: Describes changes to the datamodel product and/or file structure from one release to another

header.comment: Primary Header created by MWRFITS v1.11
Active version of the BOSS ICC
APO fMJD day at start of exposure
MJD(TAI) seconds at start of integration
TAI date at start of integration
The name of the currently loaded plate
The mapping version of the loaded plate
Type of plate (e.g. BOSS, MANGA, APOGEE, APOGEE
Survey leading this observation and its mode
dusta: PT outside dust density, 0.3 microns
dustb: PT outside dust density, 1.0 micron
MaNGA decenter in RA, redundant with MGDPOS
MaNGA decenter in Dec, redundant with MGDPOS
Normalized slithead ID. sp1&2 should match.
Normalized slithead ID. sp1&2 should match.
The position of the A collimator motor
The position of the B collimator motor
The position of the C collimator motor
sp1 mech Hartmann Top Temp, C
sp1 mech Red Cam Bottom Temp, C
sp1 mech Red Cam Top Temp, C
sp1 mech Blue Cam Bottom Temp, C
sp1 mech Blue Cam Top Temp, C
time between flush end and readout start
Fraction of bad pixels in raw image

hdu1.name: FLUX
hdu1.description: Extracted flux from the arc image [CCDROW x NFIBER].

header.comment: Number of bits per data pixel

hdu2.name: LXPEAK
hdu2.description: Wavelength and x positions of good arc lamp lines. The first element in COLUMN contains the wavelengths for each lamp line, the remaining NFIBER contains the lamp line positions along the CCD [NFIBER+1 x NLAMP]

header.comment: Number of bits per data pixel

hdu3.name: WSET
hdu3.description: Wavelength solution as Legendre polynomials for all fibers.

FUNC.name: FUNC
FUNC.description: describes the function used to fit the wavelength solutions (units of log-10 Angstroms) and Y-positions to a functional form. Chebyshev or Legendre functions are used. Default value is taken as Legendre function.

XMIN.name: XMIN
XMIN.description: minimum value of the independent variable used by fitting function.

XMAX.name: XMAX
XMAX.description: maximum value of the independent variable which is used along with the fitting coefficients, in the fitting function to get the value of dependent variable, which is the wavelength solution.

header.comment: Number of bits per data pixel

hdu5.name: DISPSET
hdu5.description: Dispersion solution (1sigma LSF in pixels) as Legendre polynomials

FUNC.name: FUNC
FUNC.description: describes the function used to fit the line width (units of pixels) and Y-positions to a functional form. Chebyshev or Legendre functions are used. Default value is taken as Legendre function.

XMIN.name: XMIN
XMIN.description: minimum value of the independent variable used by fitting function.

XMAX.name: XMAX
XMAX.description: maximum value of the independent variable which is used along with the fitting coefficients, in the fitting function to get the value of dependent variable, which is the line width of fibers.
